column6: my very first twitter post in preparation for vegas
this is my first tweet from my cell. im a techie!
welcome to my grand experiment in modern technology. poker updates start at noon sat vegas time. can't wait!
good morning.  gameday prep going well.  the eliptical machine rues the day...
did photos and q&a with espn. lots of poker vs. investing questions.  at table 47 seat 3.   ready to go!
don,t know anyone.  starting 30k. folded first hand. don't win first one. can't win them all.
kk ran into aa.  a flopped.  only lost 4k
right at 30k at first break.
good 2 hrs.  lost medium pot with jj vs qq and a 10-9-8 flop.  otherwise all good .  37k going into 90 min dinner break.
folding....folding...folding....33.5k
miserable round.  flopped a set of aces and won a small pot and two other small ones.  but overall calling too many bets and eventually  ...
missed flush draw...bluffed river...got called...19k
done for the day.  hanging in by a finger nail. 8k left. longer version to follow.
back in vegas.  cheryl finished 16th. gametime today is noon. i start with 8k
ak vs aj   i double up  !
end of level 5. 19k.  missed all 5 flops i saw. better game face today. table ok
1 asian with wsop bracelet.  many short stacks.
dribbling along...16.5k
basically first hand in 2 hrs.  aq ran in to aa.  see ya next year.
Game on. 1hr in. I like my seating. Up a little.
Good first level. 36,700. Playing good. Flopped a full house. Good table image.
Hour 3 card dead.  Same spot zzzzzzzzzzz
Level 2...done .... Nothing happened.... 36k
Dinner break. Had a nice run up to 45k...ran into something yucky on 2nd hand before break....back to 34k
Sad and short. With the queen ten of diamonds on the button, I saw a four way flop 973 with two diamonds. Everyone checked.
Then the 8 of diamonds. The small blind bet 2500, I raised 9k. The river was  a 3. He bet 10k. I called to see 9s full.
A few hands later ak ran into Aa. All done
@LeeKLem now that is funny. I can't imagine hour    to hour updates.  Have a great weekend
@yaq617 truth is, I felt a cringe when the board paired.
Greetings from Vegas!  Getting ready for WSOP. Playing tomorrow on team for MJ Fox. New kids' handprint sweatshirts should bring luck.
Tremendous pre game coaching effort for Team Fox by Phil Gordon. Followed by enormous Chinese banquet. The team is good to go.
Table 371 seat 2. Wifey is a 321. Seat 8. She looks great in sweatshirt http://t.co/fyjtssp
First break. Humberto brennes and Marcel luske at my table. Flopped top set last hand before break. Nice pot. 41k.
Level 2. Win some lose some. All small. 37k
Doubled up!  Donkey player called my push. 76k. At dinner.
Getting abused. But staying patient. 66k.
Strong finish to level. The Gordon bluff and a set. 80k
Bagged and done. 94,400. Call me pocket tens. Dan is out. Cheryl also (in the last ten minutes). Justin sitting and Reid sitting pretty 55k
Vinit and ari hanging on for dear life.
Day 2. Seated...game on.
1 hr in. Nothing happened. Breaking my table. So much for that table image :). Actually, happy to go.
First break 80k. New table is very tough
Nothing good. Down to 51k and would be worse if I didn't make a good fold. Haven't won more than a trivial pot in four hours.
Dinner break.  More of the same 40k. Sheesh.
It comes to an end. I got my money in good on a made hand on the turn.  But he had 19 outs on the river and hit one.
RT @theback9: Bank of America has zero access to capital markets, the only way they can sell debt is in the high yield market and thats  ...
Off to Vegas tonight.  I will be tweeting from the WSOP.  Gonna be fun...I hope.
@feru012 just checked twitter for first time in a year.  You might want to rethink that advice lol.

http://t.co/omG4eGAy

My seat draw. Happy to be here.  Feeling the love from all the city year corps members #
On way in red city year cap and jacket. Friend who  goes by "Chance" sent cool card protector. CY logo on one side/ my kids on the other!
@droitman
Chiptic is free today to follow. Access it from the main page of http://t.co/iZ2wzPXX
Sitting down after huge staged intro. Probably 10 minutes away. Our table breaks first.
When I host a charity poker tourney, I make a point of trying to keep the speeches short.  Not here. We are seated. Shuffle up.
First break.  Fun watching everyone else play. I worked my folding muscle. Am up a trivial amount.
Won very nice pot from ELKY on a flopped set.
Second break. About 4.8 mm. Won a second good pot off Gus Hansen.
Dinner break. About $5.6 mm. Running good. Lots of adrenaline. :)
New table. 5.1 mm.  1 hour to go.
A bit of a tough hour. 3.8 mm.  Good nite.  Ready for tomorrow.

@AlexBerenson 

This is right.  I am playing for City Year.
@AlexBerenson   Yes. But I will not send till after tourney.
Game on.  Won a couple small ones right away.
Favorable table draw to be wasted.  We are first to break.
Table break 4.7 mm
New table. Lots of good players. Chipping up 5.4 mm -- both Phil's and Gus. Should be fun.
On break. About $5.3. 26 left. They redraw the tables at 24. Too bad. I like playing these guys.

Redraw pending.  5.4 mm. 

Having fun!
Very card dead. Whittled down to 4.4 mm at break.
Finally hit a big hand. Doubled up to over $8 mm.
Dinner break. Around $8 mm. A good time for a break.
Another card dead couple hours. Playing tight. Hanging in at $8 mm. Down to 11 players.   Gonna be awhile to get to 8, I think.
Final table. Ten players. They pay 9.  Up to 9.4 MM
In the money!
Down to 9.  Playing till one more person is out.
Down to 8. Game over...for tonight. 8.5 mm chips.
All set for intros.  No tweeting today...espn will keep everyone posted best. Should be fun.
A few thoughts about the One Drop and WSOP.  First: That was a lot of fun.  Just a great competition and I enjoyed every bit.
Second: Congrats to the winner.  He was the best man on that day.
Third: I want to thank my coaches: Brandon Adams, Phil Gordon and Mike McDonald.  You improved my game and my thinking.
Fourth: I want to thank my family, friends and partners for sweating me.  You know who you are.
Fifth:  I want to thank the various city year corp members for those awesome pictures. You guys are doing the real work in the trenches,
It was a great experience. But, I am all pokered out.  I have decided to skip the main event.  I look forward to future games.
A final thanks to everyone who cheered me on.  I felt the love.  No surprise: this will likely be my last tweet until next time.
RT @ChadQuotes: Einhorn (@DavidEin) was getting about 8-to-1 in the big blind there, but his hand was 3-2; The man knows Risk management ...
Apparently I have a twitter impersonator.  @Greenlightcap is not me.  I also have no plans to tweet about stocks.  :).
RT @PhilNoLimits: Hosting poker night for my friend @realmikefox tonight in New York.  Great guy and a great cause. Raised  3m+ in this  ...
Just landed in Vegas.  Ready for summer vacation part 1.  Playing in the one drop high roller starting tomorrow at noon.  😃😃😃😃
For this tourney i'm playing for @Playworks! Positive play + recess = less bullying & improved learning 4 all kids . Play on! #recesscounts
Signed up and ready.  Table 446, seat 5. (I like seat 5--good for those of us with bad eyes). Game on!
I don't immediately recognize anyone at my table...except Tom Dwan on my immediate left.  122 entrants so far.
Rough first two hours. Lost one big hand, but I think it a good lay down.   I have about 185k (started with 300).   Long way to go (I hope)
2nd break.  Slow grind down. Not connecting with flops.  170k or so.
Early after the break.  Won a couple nice pots. 270k.
Phone died and needed recharge.  At dinner break with 451k.  Very good level with several nice pots.  Dinner not bad, either.
Two more hours.  I spent the time mostly donating chips slowly.  365k.  Table dynamic is improving, though.
All done....for the night.  Big second to last hand.  Ended with 519k.  In the game :)
First break.  500k in chips.  Not much happened.  Half the field is now out. My table will break soon.
I kept getting chipped down.  And the same guy showed up with AA twice in a row.  I busted around 70th.   Recess is over.  Back to school!
Back in Vegas for summer vacation part 2.  Today, I play the Main Event.  Back to history...White Sweatshirt with my kids' good hands.

I'm playing the main event for the Michael J Fox foundation.  http://t.co/yYFVL2ZI4I. #cure Parkinson's.
5 hours to game time.
I'm good to go.  Table 371.  Such a rush...when patience is the prescription.  Makes it fun.
First break.  All small pots. Started with 30k now at 31.2k.  They play is sooo much faster than one drop. Get many more hands!
2nd break.  Losing an evil amount of small pots.  21k.
Dinner break. AA on the button....won me the blinds.  I have yet to be in a good situation.  18k.  Time to eat.
Clawed my way back to 27k.  Only to go out on a turned flush over flush.  Really ugly tourney.  Ugh.
At @einhornscookies debut NY comic-con.  Epically delicious.  How big things get started! http://t.co/GjXnOUYyvY
Proud to celebrate those who #makebetterhappen @CityYear 25th! #cy25th http://t.co/Npl9sGMP4Z
9 Days till #BigOneforOneDrop. This year I'm playing to fight poverty  for @RobinHoodNYC.  Looks like an impossible field.  Can't wait @WSOP
Half an hour to go!  Got sunglasses in @RobinHoodNYC colors.  All good to go.  Table draws coming up soon @wsop http://t.co/3NDKkpNTpk
They finally drew tables.  Old times: I have Sam Trickett on my right. Vanessa Selbst next to him. Fun stuff.  We may start soon.  :)
Ok. That didn't go well. First one out.  Couldn't make it an hour.   Tough hand.   ...  Try again at the main event. :(
Hand details:  with JJ in the small blind I reraised Trickett. Flop was j-6-2 rainbow. I bet he called. Turn was a 3. I bet he raised.
I reraised he called. River was a Q, I bet.  He shoved (not much more). I called and lost to 4-5.  Fun game.
@rolandoflondon I remember our play.  I needed your sense of humor, yesterday.  Rebuy?  You didn't even buy once 😃
@skiki13 75k into a 114k pot.
@skiki13 He was probably floating and hoping to push me off AK or AQ on most turns.

After the One Drop left me feeling like Teddy KGB (I feel so unsatisfied)
http://t.co/w6PQrw4pc0, today I plan to last > 1 hr.
I've made it twice as far as in One Drop. Mission accomplished!  I'm practicing my folding muscle. Just below starting 30k
I'm a straight magnet.  My QQ ran into a 2-3-4 flop.  Opp had a-5.  I held my loss to 12k. 2nd break 18k left. I'm improving!
Flopped a set and got paid. 33k at dinner. Just Broke our table again. Too bad, I loved the second table.  New table feels very tough.
End of level 4.  Grinding higher. 45k
All done for the night. Very slow level. I end with 42,900.   Sleepy time.  We continue Tuesday.
Very tough level.  Did WELL to contain damage down to 14k b4 doubling up as  JJ held v AK. 31k.
KK doubles me up again vs QJ after a J flopped.  72k. Feeling happy to be here.
A couple absurd hands where I could have lost even more brought me down to 49k at end of level 7.
Getting ground down. 31k at the dinner break. Third table for me.
End of a good level. J8 in big blind doubled up vs AK button. On A88 flop. Then I finally hit a draw.  91k
I don't think I played great, but I would up with 99,700.  Day 3 for me is Thursday.  Gotta be pleased to still be here. G'nite.
First break.  No good cards that level and villain made trip 3s on the river with 7-3.  73k.  Staying patient.
Grind grind grind. 84k..fold fold fold fold fold.  You get the idea.  Second break
Slow played my KK and doubled up. 147k. :)
165k.  Dinner break.
After running up to 225k, i lose with QQ and AA in the same orbit. 145k at the last break.
Done early for the night.  Volatile level.  All is well that ends well 174,500.  Back for more in the morning.
At first break.  Bad job flopping.  Down to 95k.
We are in the money.  @RobinHoodNYC gets whatever I win to fight poverty in New York!  Time to be a short stack warrior!
At the break.   I got short and doubled up.  Leaves me at 95k.
Another double up.  This time very lucky as AJ beats AQ. Almost 200k.
Dinner break.  I chipped up to 220k http://t.co/X6hXkyu2lI
One hand after I lay down 99 to an all in, I double up with AA over KK. 260k
Doubled again. Set of 6s cracks JJ.  500k. :)
My flirtation with an averagish stack was short lived.  I bag 284k and return tomorrow to continue my role as short stack warrior!
Good afternoon. a-10 suited flushes to crack KK and I double up. 510k.  Short stack warrior! @RobinHoodNYC
First break.  530k.   Watching paint dry.
Ok. Get this?  I call 300k with QQ to run into KK.  The board comes a2345 and we split the pot. Running good #shortstackwarrior
Chipping up.  Nice cards. 685k at second break. Less than 200 people left.  #shortstackwarrior
Sadly all done.  AJ vs AQ and I couldn't find another miracle.  Lots of fun and no TeddyKGB regrets.  173rd place 44,728 for @RobinHoodNYC
Every kid deserves a school powered by play because #PlayWorks. Thanks @Playworks for the great night!
Poker season!  Playing for @FacingHistory @WSOP. One Drop starts Sun.  Helping kids be #Upstanders & to stop hate http://t.co/gr5nfiFjFl
Ready to go! @FacingHistory @WSOP to support #FacingHistory http://t.co/gr5nfiFjFl. We start in moments. http://t.co/xa82iCMnYe
First break. Nothing exciting. Started with 300k. I have about 308k.  Table seems fine. People are quiet.
After a long period of card dead, I lost 1/3 of chips against a turned gutshot straight held by 5-4suited.  Well, better than last time. Ugh
Grounded down to 85k, doubled with AKo vs AQs, chipped up.  295k at the dinner break. Happy to be back in the game.
4th break. 375k.  The highlight was all in with AK vs AK.  We spilt the pot and divided the blinds and antes!!  Cost of poker is going up.
My a9 cracked a very good player's KK and busted him.  Lucky me. 650k.  Half the field is gone.
Just when it looked fun. aQ on a q-10-5 flop. Ran into q-10.  Arghh.  Try again at the main event. A fun day.
Time to start the main event.  I hope to give the opponents some History to Face!  Shuffling up and dealing soon.
First break.  33k.  A fine table.  Made a tight fold.  I will never know if that was right.  k9 on a KkJxx board. Hmmm
Nice level. No setbacks. Won a nice pot on last hand of level j-10 vs 10-8 on a j98xx board. 47k
Didn't win a pot for 90 minutes. Went down to 30k.  Then hit two flops. 53k at the dinner break.
Lost 15k to a set of fours...and an hour later won a little more with my own set of fours. Win some - lose some.  $57k
Wow.  Busto meltdown. AJs with flop K10-9 with my flush draw into KK. No help.  Shortly later and short stacked A10 in JJ. Ugh. Next year.
Join @StartEmpathy celebrating young #changemakers w/ @think_it_up on tv tonight 8/7c! http://t.co/hdXPM3HYk6 #StartEmpathy @EinhornTrust
http://t.co/YbFkw7Xpwp
RT @EinhornTrust: Our ED @jennrothberg demonstrating how trusting relationships drive impact https://t.co/CfBsvBrkx6
I am about to land in Vegas for an early start to poker season. Super excited to play in the super highroller bowl starting Sunday #SHRBowl
I'm playing for @WelcomingUSA working to build #inclusive communities for everyone, including immigrants & refugees. #WelcomingCity #SHRBowl
Dressed and ready.  1 pm seems to be Morrow a suggestion. https://t.co/1qbqB7QLkT
1 level in and I'm right where I started. At least table play is pretty quick.
Level 2.  Very dead. Lost the one flop I hit hard. I'm at 220k vs 300k to start.
Third break 165k.  Time to reverse the trend.  And time to stop running in straights
Pretty good round....till the last hand where I busted.  KK vs 87o.  Flop j8x all diamonds. We both have a diamond. Turn 8!
Look who is having dinner in Rye. https://t.co/NTwd7ZiHfq
Second chance for poker. Playing in the one drop for @WelcomingUSA.  It's a great time to support our immigrants. I will tweet chip updates.
First break. Started with 500k, now just over 600k. Just moved tables.  Frying pan to fire.
Second break. 700k.  Some fun hands.  Having fun.
Couldn't hit a thing.  Did great to reach dinner at 630
Card dead...except a set of aces. 4th break. 575j
Done for the night.  Played nicely.  Happy and tired.  1.1 million 😄😄
Icky round.  Chip and a chair. 550k.  Blinds getting big.  Time to go big 😄
Doubled up!  a-10s beats KQ. 1.3mm 😄. About 50 left
1430000 at the second break.  Not exactly able to exhale.  But quite alive.
Oh my.  I busted.  My KQ ran into 77 on a k-10-7 flop.   Try the main event on Monday.  Too bad. Played well vs great players.
Game time.  Starting equipment!  Ready for fun. @WelcomingUSA https://t.co/yKnZRI424t
First break. Cards meh. Bracelet winner on my left.  49k.  Long ways to go.
Down to 44k, I made a move doomed to fail, then sucked out on the river. 63k
Second break. 64k.
Last hand b din.  I raise 800 from cut off with 10-8d Raiseto 2200. I call. Flop 972 flush draw. Get it all in vs 97. Turn 2 River 10 105k
To clarify: villain was all in. I had 25k more. 😄😄😄
I hero folded A♦️K♦️ after 3 betting 3500. Followed by a 4 bet 10500 from A♣️K♣️ and a 5 bet from A♥️A♠️. Running well and playing well 118k
End of level 4. 110k. Like my new table.
Hit a flush and busted a short stack who had pocket aces. 145k
Just folded J♥️J♦️after getting 3b by AA and 4 bet by KK.  Lost just 1300. 158k with 20 min to go
Paid off QQ vs my ak.  All done. 128,400.  Good night. Back on Wednesday 😄😄
No cards.  Patience.  114k.  First break.
Went almost the whole level without winning a pot post flop. Zero cards, zero flops. 86500.  Hanging and waiting.
Crazy round.  I went down to 25k. As the deck remained icy.  Then it turned my way.  And when it turned, it really turned. 170k dinner
I flop top set of jacks. The turn is an A.  It get in and I double someone up, when he has AA.
5 hands later flop a set of 9s from the blinds and pay off runner runner flush. 48k
At the break 45k
Nice solid level.  85k. We will play 1 more hour tonight.
All done. 114k.  Try some more starting noon.
All In with JJ vs QQ. A jack flops! I double up. Living on a borrowed life 170k
Extra life is shortish. On fumes. AQ loses to Q7s on an A flop against an eventual flush. 12k.  Time to make a move 😩
Out of fumes and out of chips. The fun ends. Time to go home. 😭
Thank you @FacingHistoryNY for such a great night and for helping students become upstanders https://t.co/gsBZYRc7HQ
@MaraJams    Thank You!  They are. Call my office 212 973 1900 and we will retrieve them.
RT @EinhornTrust: Thanks @LeapofReason! https://t.co/1mH8bJPPBz
@nofalsehoodsplz you don't need to.  You get 1 div share for every share you own.  If you just hold both, you'd be in the same place.
Poker time! Every day @cityyear shows up for kids & helps them succeed. I'm Competing in #SHRBowl to help more students & schools. Game on!
#SHRBowl   Starts tomorrow afternoon.  Bringing back my red jacket #cityyear. !!
Starting now.  #SHRBowl    Let's have a good game and win some for #cityyear https://t.co/xPRWb3krAe
First break.  Played very few hands. One well took me to 330K...1 bad flop and back to 305k.  Started at 300k.  Early going
Second break.  Lost a hand, won. Hand. 301k.  Playing tight. #SHRBowl
3rd break.  Finally won a good pot on the last hand of the level.  $345k
Nice level.  Won a few good hands. Good image, playing well. 430k
Chipped down. But limited the damage. Still playing well.  Would be nice to hit a hand.  Didn't happen that level. 365k after 5 levels
End of level 6. Won a decent pot against the star.  386 K.  One more to go tonight.
After getting ground down....good cards and missing missing missing. I finally turn a flush on second last hand and win vs a set. 483k nite!
Proud to partner with @cityyear to help students get along better and reach for their dreams. Playing for them today at #SHRBowl on Day 2
Just about to start day 2.  I'm on the TV table.  30 minute delay.  So broadcast starts in half and hour #cityyear #SHRBowl #me-vs.-talent
1st break. 400k.  Nothing good
Great level.   Cards cards cards!!! And a bluff.  And a plug for my daughter!  And a bigger plug for #cityyear.  630k!!! 😄
Good level. Still getting some cards...unlike yesterday.  Lost a couple small flips.  But overall good spot. 710k
Running strong.  Next break 830k!!!
Next level 959k.  Running good. Having fun
End of level 13.  Some ups and downs and more chips at risk than before. 1,025,000.  table got tougher.  1 level to go tonight.
A brutal level. I kept getting AK and it didn't turn out well.  Finished with 685k.  Plenty of chips to compete for #cityyear tomorrow
@realcharder30 Day 3.  Starting 685k which is 10 out of remaining 19 players.  Not at the tv table so you all can concentrate on your day jobs 😄.
Day 3 starting. 685k which is 10th out of 19.  No TV table to start so you can all concentrate on your day jobs 😄😄.  #cityyear
Lost a number of small pots. Bad cards no flops....until flopping bottom set and doubling up 900k. level 15 ending
We are down to 14.  Two tables. I'm moving to the TV table.  925k still
I got all my chips in very good. But, back luck hit.  That was a good tourney.  Sorry to go. #SHRBowl #cityyear
#wsop today! I'm playing for @WelcomingUSA working to build #inclusive communities for all, including immigrants & refugees. #WelcomingCity
First break lost a tough hand with aK vs Aq on AxxxQ board. 38k
Went down to 21k after being bluffed and then turning 2 PR vs a set. Came back turning a set of my own. 33k. 2nd break.
Well nothing went right today. Lost a lot with aK on a K368q board to k3.  Then 3 bet jammed with qQ got called by 99, who hit a set. Ugh
@Joebtracy Yes. When you jam and lose, you go look for dinner and think about the offseason.
@tradenator I don't tweet about the market.  Thx for the nice note, though
@cate_long    I don’t. 😄
I want to thank @elonmusk for the shorts. He is a man of his word!  They did come with some manufacturing defects. #tesla https://t.co/qsYfO8cbkp

If @Tesla wants to save the human species, it should pay more attention to the
safety of its own customers. You shouldn’t have to be Walmart to have your
dangerous solar panels fixed. @Elonmusk

How many solar panels are still defective and could cause fires? @Tesla should
immediately notify the people who live in and work in buildings at risk. Secret
Project Titan is over the line. A recall should have happened long ago @USCPSC.
 @Elonmusk should resign.
@elonmusk @zerohedge @elonmusk #Tesla  #TSLA @zerohedge https://t.co/DrMk9SWjlf
Dear @elonmusk, Silence. https://t.co/7mzud757ZM

Congrats Heather and Adam!!!
Podcast Playlist: iHeartMedia Orders Slate of YA Projects From Einhorn's Epic Productions https://t.co/fqypWHUIQ1
Dear @elonmusk @TSLA, More Boring Bonehead Questions https://t.co/yohjj7FQfj
Nobody expresses it better than Joan McCullough.  $TSLA @elonmusk https://t.co/cprfZCglTZ
Trying again...larger 😀.  part 1/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk https://t.co/0O94BFJTlz
Trying again larger 😀 Part 2/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk https://t.co/Y8eEkctCca

Trying again larger.  3/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk 

Nobody expresses it better than Joan McCullough https://t.co/CeTUdlCbYC

I’m proud to share this update on my foundation. We’re working to address polarization, loneliness, bigotry, and the lack of cooperation that prevents our country from tackling our biggest problems effectively and collaboratively  https://t.co/p5qlfA0Yxc https://t.co/C89BuJkDaK
RT @kylascan: What’s going on with $HWIN? 🥪 https://t.co/Enb7cznLzz

This is how @sprucepointcap quoted me on Danimer Scientific (DNMR)…

Taking me out of context like this proves my point. $DNMR #QuoteCrime https://t.co/fiDWW4wyD0
RT @ecornell_online: Join us 01/27 @ 6PM ET for a conversation with renowned investor & philanthropist @davidein! Hosted by @CornellMBA's A…

I'm excited to see this release. It’s time for a national conversation about social connection. We must bridge our divides & find ways to work better together. It’s time for a #CallToConnection. I hope you’ll join me. Learn more here: https://t.co/dtJs5Xib6O
